meanings.definition: Very close in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The two houses are proximately located, just a short walk away from each other.
meanings.sent2: The meeting is scheduled proximately after lunch, around 1 p.m.
meanings.sent3: The siblings are so proximately aged that people often mistake them for twins.
meanings.sent4: The proximately placed trees in the garden create a cozy and intimate atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The proximately parked cars made it easy for the friends to hop from one to the other.

meanings.sent1: She proximately responded to the question without any hesitation.
meanings.sent2: The ambulance arrived proximately after the call for help.
meanings.sent3: He proximately grabbed the last piece of cake before anyone else could reach it.
meanings.sent4: The news spread proximately throughout the small town within minutes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher proximately corrected the mistake to avoid any confusion.
